Name: Standing Statuette of Henutnakhtu
Description: This wooden standing statuette shows the Lady Henutnakhtu of the Eighteenth Dynasty wearing a tight pleated garment and a very tall and beautiful wig. She is holding in her right hand a flower and in her left one a staff, with which to purify the deceased. This statuette rests on a wooden base with hieroglyphic text giving the offerings and the name of Henutnakhtu.
